name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, BUREAU OF DRIVER LICENSING, Petitioner, v. James Louis FIORE, III, Respondent

parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, BUREAU OF DRIVER LICENSING, Petitioner, v. James Louis FIORE, III, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 3'lst day of March, 1998, the petition for allowance of appeal is denied in accordance with this Court’s decision in Sullivan v. Commonwealth, Department of Transportation, Bureau of Driver Licensing, — Pa. -, 708 A.2d 481 (1998).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Timothy P. Wile, Asst. Counsel, Harold H. Cramer, Asst. Chief Counsel, Andrew S. Gordon, Chief Counsel, Paul A. Tufano, General Counsel, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
708 A.2d 486
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, BUREAU OF DRIVER LICENSING, Petitioner, v. James Louis FIORE, III, Respondent.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
March 31, 1998.
Timothy P. Wile, Asst. Counsel, Harold H. Cramer, Asst. Chief Counsel, Andrew S. Gordon, Chief Counsel, Paul A. Tufano, General Counsel, for petitioner.
